abstract: Nobody in the company, myself included, has had a minute of management training. We all come from small, struggling companies where management training and human resources departments are unheard of, where even something as basic as an employee manual is unusual.
snippet: Nobody in the company, myself included, has had a minute of management training. We all come from small, struggling companies where management training and human resources departments are unheard of, where even something as basic as an employee ma...
lead_paragraph: A business owner of no particular distinction, in an unfashionable industry, without a record of success or a vast fortune to substantiate his opinions, is given a chance to write about his company in The New York Times. He tries to tell a long, complicated story with a large cast of characters, a story that started two decades ago but concentrates on events covering the last two years.

headline.main: What I Learned From Firing My Employee of 20 Years
